comments.body: maybe mention that a tight flexible child is going to make this get essentially ignored?
I've added some "see also"s to the enum definition, but I'm reluctant to point to [Flex] too strongly.

Turns out this hides a regression: we're now missing a newline at the end of the ancestor print out, and the "See also" on the next line ends up on the last line:

```
...
I/flutter ( 4533): The nearest ancestor providing an unbounded width constraint is:
I/flutter ( 4533):   _RenderSingleChildViewport#76a9a relayoutBoundary=up10 NEEDS-LAYOUT NEEDS-PAINT
I/flutter ( 4533):   creator: _SingleChildViewport ← _ScrollableScope ← IgnorePointer-[GlobalKey#4a64a] ← Semantics ←
I/flutter ( 4533):   Listener ← _GestureSemantics ←
I/flutter ( 4533):   RawGestureDetector-[LabeledGlobalKey<RawGestureDetectorState>#20712] ←
I/flutter ( 4533):   _ExcludableScrollSemantics-[GlobalKey#fc34f] ← RepaintBoundary ← CustomPaint ← RepaintBoundary ←
I/flutter ( 4533):   NotificationListener<ScrollNotification> ← ⋯
I/flutter ( 4533):   parentData: <none> (can use size)
I/flutter ( 4533):   constraints: BoxConstraints(0.0<=w<=484.0, 0.0<=h<=920.0)
I/flutter ( 4533):   layer: OffsetLayer#77c9c
I/flutter ( 4533):   size: Size(484.0, 920.0)See also: https://flutter.io/layout/
I/flutter ( 4533): If this message did not help you determine the problem, consider using debugDumpRenderTree():
I/flutter ( 4533):   https://flutter.io/debugging/#rendering-layer
I/flutter ( 4533):   http://docs.flutter.io/flutter/rendering/debugDumpRenderTree.html
...
```
I'll submit a PR to fix it.
It would be consistent with our philosophy to have start always be "top" if the main axis is vertical.
We shouldn't need to call _startIsTopLeft twice.  We have the value above.  We can just remember it.
Nevermind, this call is for the flipped axis.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +889,893 @@        case CrossAxisAlignment.start:
        case CrossAxisAlignment.end:
          childCrossPosition = _startIsTopLeft(flipAxis(direction), textDirection, verticalDirection)
                               == (_crossAxisAlignment == CrossAxisAlignment.start)
                             ? 0.0
